Total internal reflection occurs on the side of the optical fiber, meaning the angle of incidence at the core-cladding interface must be equal to the critical angle θc.
Total internal reflection occurs when the angle of incidence θi at the boundary between two media is greater than or equal to the critical angle θc. For this situation, θi = θc.
Using Snell's law, the critical angle θc can be found: n1 sin(θc) = n2 sin(90°), simplifying to sin(θc) = n2/n1.
The angle θ is the angle of refraction inside the fiber core relative to the normal. The angle of incidence at the core-cladding boundary is θc = 90° - θ.
